page.title: 01INTRODUCTION- ETTRICK VALLEY
page.content: This area consists of part of the upper Ettrick Valley, the floor of which, some 700 metres wide, lies at an altitude of 700ft.,enclosed by hills rising to an average of l500ft. above sea level. It is watered by the River Ettrick and several small tributaries flowing from the hillsides The valley bottom consists of hayfields and rough pasture, whilst the hills provide grazing for sheep and cattle, though over the past few years a certain amount of forestry plantings of conifers has taken place The dewellings consist of a few farms with their associated buildings and cottages, the remainder being private residences and holiday homes. It is an area popular with tourists, drawn by the peace and tranquility which exists.
